arguments.li: Obsidian is quite brittle and not as good for building. It is however quite beautiful, blocks be sold for good money, and it makes very sharp weapons.
A volcanic rock formed by rapid cooling of lava.
A rock formed by slow cooling of magma.
A rock formed by slow cooling of basaltic lava.
A soft rock formed by consolidation of volcanic ash.
A very soft rock converted from various minerals through a combination of heating, pressure and time.
A common and widely distributed type of metamorphic rock.
A rock which consists of layers of different minerals.
A very soft rock formed from the skeletal remains of sea creatures.
A rock composed mostly of silt.
A rock formed by the compaction of silt and clay-size mineral particles.
An ugly rock formed from consolidated mud.
A rock composed primarily of clay-sized particles.
A very porous rock produced when lava with a very high content of water and gases is discharged from a volcano.
A volcanic rock resembling andesite but containing free quartz.
An igneous rock showing a very coarse texture.
A fine-grained metamorphic rock with a well-developed laminar structure.
An incredibly hard rock that originally formed a moon, but due to collisions with space debree huge pieces often hit the planet.
A soft rock composed of broken shells.
A dark, coarse-grained plutonic rock of crystalline texture.
A brittle volcanic rock formed by rapid cooling of lava.
Solid desert glass formed by radiative melting of sandstone from large aerial bursts.
An incredibly heavy and tough rock that originally formed a meteorite.
A unique rock of unknown origin. It absorbs 99% light, making it look like a pitch black void.
